item.title: Report E-2024050252
item.description:
Report E-2024050252

Identified by scraper @ 2024-05-15T15:11:51+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-04-16
  • City: SAN ANTONIO
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO Teminal Incidents
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: XPO terminal LSX contacted the call center to report a spill that occurred on 4/16 inside of a trailer in San Antonio, TX. The spill consisted of 0.75 liters of Make-Up Fluid V706-D printing ink, which was found crushed due to other freight stacked on top of the carton containing the cartridge, spilling out onto the trailer floor.

item.title: Report X-2024050412
item.description:
Report X-2024050412

Identified by scraper @ 2024-05-13T15:12:55+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-05-08
  • City: TYLER
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Federal Express Corporation
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: The package was brought to the attention of AM QA (preload) and was processed by (ID 3367368). My concerns are as follows: the package was soiled/stained due the crushed product that is the Nu-Brite Condenser Coil Cleaner which caused it to leak about 10% of the 3.8 liters within the jug. One of Four were damaged. There was no inner packaging - just the four plastic jugs. It could have had some sort of air bubbles, bubble wrap, or even paper.
